chat.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è Google I/O 2023 is a wrap ‚Äî here's a list of everything announced | TechCrunch - https://techcrunch.com/2023/05/10/heres-everything-google-has-announced-at-i-o-so-far/

Google I/O 2023 is a wrap ‚Äî here's a list of everything announced | TechCrunch

Google announced a range of new products and updates at its developer conference, Google I/O 2023. The highlights included new features for Google Maps, a range of AI-powered photo editing tools, updates to the Workspace suite, the introduction of the new Pixel 7a and Pixel Fold smartphones, and early tests of an AI-powered translation service.

- Google Maps introduced a new immersive view for routes and additional helpful information for users in select cities.
- Google's AI-powered photo editing tools for Magic Editor and Magic Compose will allow for more complex edits and rewriting of texts.
- PaLM 2, Google's newest large language model, will set the foundation model for most of Google's new AI features, including Bard chat tool.
- Google's Workspace suite will receive AI features such as automatic table generation in Sheets and image creation in Slides and Meet.
- MusicLM is Google's new experimental AI tool that turns text into music.
- Google Search has two new features related to better understanding content and image context in search results.
- Google's new smartwatch operating system, Wear OS 4, will feature improved battery life, improved functionality, and new accessibility features.
- Universal Translator is an experimental AI service that synchronizes translated speech with a speaker's lips to put video in a new language.
- The Pixel Tablet and Pixel Fold smartphones were unveiled.
- Firebase, Google's backend-as-a-service platform for application developers, is introducing AI extensions powered by the PaLM API.
- The Play Store will receive updates like automated translations and other promotional efforts for Android apps, as well as new security and privacy features for developers.

‚ö†Ô∏è GitHub replaces code search engine with Rust-based Blackbird - https://www.theregister.com/2023/05/09/blackbirdgithubsearch/

GitHub replaces code search engine with Rust-based Blackbird ‚Ä¢ The Register

GitHub has launched its Blackbird code search engine, which uses Rust technology to make text-based computer code searches faster. The tool enables developers to search, navigate and understand source code more quickly, alongside a redesigned code view allowing greater code navigation capabilities. GitHub's previous search engine, Elasticsearch, faced outages, leading the company to opt for an in-house solution. The updated search engine enables rapid exact-match and regex queries.
‚ö†Ô∏è GitHub now auto-blocks token and API key leaks for all repos - https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/github-now-auto-blocks-token-and-api-key-leaks-for-all-repos/amp/

GitHub now auto-blocks token and API key leaks for all repos

GitHub blocks the leak of sensitive information for all public code repositories by introducing push protection, which proactively prevents leaks by scanning for secrets before 'git push' operations. This feature works with 69 token types, and it is detectable with a low "false positive" detection rate. The push protection prompt will appear with information on the secret type, location, and how to remediate the exposure. The software developers who enabled it successfully averted around 17,000 accidental exposures of sensitive information. GitHub also made it generally available on all public repos.

- GitHub automatically blocks the leak of sensitive information for all public code repositories.
- Push protection proactively prevents leaks by scanning for secrets before 'git push' operations.
- Push protection works with 69 token types detectable with a low "false positive" detection rate.
- The prompt will appear with information on the secret type, location, and how to remediate the exposure.
- Software developers who enabled it successfully averted around 17,000 accidental exposures of sensitive information.
- GitHub has made push protection generally available on all public repos.
- Push protection is available for private repositories with a GitHub Advanced Security (GHAS) license.

Anthropic | Introducing 100K Context Windows

Anthropic has expanded its natural language tool Claude's context window from 9k to 100k tokens, allowing businesses to submit large documents for analysis and conversations with Claude to go for hours.¬†

* Claude now has a context window of 100k tokens¬†

* The new development allows Claude to analyse documents quickly¬†

* The software can provide summaries of lengthy texts, financial statements, and research papers¬†

* Claude can quickly answer technical questions and assist with code modification¬†

* The technology can also be used to identify risks and arguments in legal documents, and analyse annual reports.¬†

* The larger context windows are available in the company's API.

Announcing Dart 3
100% sound null safety. Records, patterns, and class modifiers. And a peek into the future.

Announcing Dart 3. 100% sound null safety. Records‚Ä¶ | by Michael Thomsen | Dart | May, 2023 | Medium

Dart has announced version 3, which includes 100% sound null safety and major new language features like records, patterns, and class modifiers. Migration to Dart 3 is expected to be easy for most packages, with only a few cases requiring related cleanup. The new language features simplify how structured data is built and worked with and provide fine-grained access controls for large API surfaces. Also, a preview of the future with Dart's coming support for WebAssembly was announced.
